subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: File from tonight--Bruce
author: Robin Searcy Henson
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_007F_01C86693.848A7030
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

It's always refreshing to read your input Bruce.  Funny thing is, I recogni=
ze Mike and Lisa on your recordings too.  I'm aware that they are acting as=
 facilitators and guardians, that they are consistent in their ability to u=
se varied modes of communication, and that their contact appears to be purp=
oseful, as compared to so much that seems to have no rhyme or reason.  

As=
 a newbie I'm admittedly intimidated by and in awe of the results you more =
experienced researchers are accomplishing.  What I find most awesome is tha=
t everyone can have different methods, belief systems and opinions and come=
 together in one forum to share and learn from one another.  I feel so luck=
y to have found you!  Bruce, your ability to hear and accurately repeat my =
one posted EVP is the only validation I've personally ever received that ma=
kes me know I'm involved in something real and life altering.  I'm supposed=
 to be here!  I think a big part of my education will continue to come from=
 the knowledge and experience you all are willing to keep sharing.  It's al=
so a fact that each of us needs to find his/her own individual truth.  

I'=
m still troubled by the possibility that we could be pawns in Someone Else'=
s science experiment.  I can sense Frank's cynicism related to the messages=
 being meaningless and the messengers being untrustworthy.  In your own cas=
e, what is the goal?  Is the fact that you've established communication and=
 continue to communicate enough?  Are we hoping to gain invaluable informat=
ion from our guides, or just to have the comfort of knowing they are there?=
  

This is the week I've promised myself to start doing sessions with the =
Radio Shack hacks!  

Robin





hoogroups.com<mailto:myself.@yahoogroups.c=
om> 
  Sent: Sunday, February 03, 2008 6:25 AM
  Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re:=
 File from tonight


  Robin,
   
  I agree with Steve on a couple of point=
s. First let me say that I
  do believe that we all have a "technician/guid=
e/guardian" call them what you
  may. but I usually call them by the names =
they introduced themselves by.
   
  I know for a fact through many, many, =
many box sessions that when I turn
  a box on, could be Frank's box or the =
minibox or the RS 470 does not matter which.
   
  The same two entities wi=
ll come through immediately, So much so now, that I do not even ask for con=
formation that
  it is in fact them. I recognise their individual voice pat=
terns. I have built a solid relationship with these two spirits
  I know as=
 mike and Lisa so much so that I have even gotten to know their individual =
personalities.
   
  There are other newer researchers here that will attes=
t to the fact that when they where doing their first sessions
  I had asked=
 my two "Friends" Mike and Lisa to assist in getting them started and invar=
iably the spirits that came 
  through to these new researchers during thei=
r first sessions identified themselves as Mike and Lisa.
   
  Steve says h=
e does not turn on his box and use them as a crutch, that is not entirely t=
rue. I had done research 
  very closely with Steve until recently and I wo=
uld venture to say that 99% if not every session he starts with "Mike & Lis=
a
  are you available to talk with me" 
   
  Also I don't consider working=
 with my technicians as using them as a crutch, They would not allow that.
=
  They are not there like butlers at our beckoned call when we feel they ma=
y be of some use.
  Quite the opposite, without them we would get no commun=
ication at all, they are allowing us the honor of receiving this 
  celesti=
al communication. They are the moderators, facilitators and generators of a=
ll we hear and send to and from the spirit realm.
  And they also stand as =
guards and protectors to do the best they can to keep us from being deceive=
d or taken down a dark path.
   
  Some here wait for others to state an op=
inion and then tend to agree with that opinion no matter what they have exp=
erienced to be true.
   
  Robin, my advice to you as a new researcher in t=
his field. Form your own beliefs through your experience and research.
  Li=
sten and learn from others but do not let what you believe to be true or no=
t, be swayed by popular opinion.
   
  Bruce




  Bruce Halliday 



  <ht=
tp://free-paranormalinvestigating.com/%3C/div%3E%3C/div%3E%3Cp%20/%3E%3Cdiv=
%20class=3D>

    To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
    From: MudPuddleFarm@m=
sn.com
    Date: Sat, 2 Feb 2008 21:42:09 -0800
    Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] =
Re: File from tonight


    Steve,

    I certainly appreciate your thought=
s.  In the back of my mind is always the question of whether we are being D=
eceived.  Just for the sake of argument, is it POSSIBLE we're being manipul=
ated by something evil?  I'm not frightened, and I won't stop my own resear=
ch (the negative stuff just makes me more determined), but my mind does go =
there sometimes.  I hope that along with developing my "ear" I can acquire =
the gift of discernment.

    Robin


      ----- Original Message ----- 
 =
     From: Steve Hultay<mailto:urkel23@...> 
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogro=
ups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com> 
      Sent: Saturday, February 02,=
 2008 8:57 PM
      Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: File from tonight:


      Robin=
,

      If i may add my thoughts on this: There is no concrete evidence of=
 
      who or what comes through is what they say they are. Technicians i =

      have found were used to get you up and running and i only now call o=
n 
      them if i need assistance. I don't turn the boxes on and ask for 
=
      them like a crutch, i conduct my session and if i need help they will=
 
      supply it to me if needed. I think the whole idea is to find out wh=
o 
      we are communicating with, maybe we will never really know for sur=
e 
      but i still try and find out as best as i can. 

      -Steve H.

=
      --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>, "Robi=
n Searcy Henson" 
      <MudPuddleFarm@...> wrote:
      >
      > Hi Frank=
, 
      > 
      > When you mention being distrustful of what comes throug=
h the boxes, 
      are you saying you're skeptical of the "technicians" be=
ing who they 
      say they are? Not trying to open another can of worms h=
ere, just 
      wanting to continue learning from your experience and rese=
arch. I 
      get what you're saying about becoming obsessive with the ses=
sions. 
      I've probably asked you this a half dozen times over the last=
 couple 
      of years, but who or what do YOU think you're/we're communic=
ating 
      with?
      > 
      > Robin
      > 
      > 
      > ----- O=
riginal Message ----- 
      > From: purplespacefriend<mailto:purplealiengi=
rl@...> 
      > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com=
><mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>> 
      > =
Sent: Saturday, February 02, 2008 7:46 PM
      > Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Fi=
le from tonight
      > 
      > 
      > Have ya tried EVPmaker? It is bas=
ed on that random principle, and 
      > predates the boxes.
      > 
    =
  > I've heard this stuff before, about random being the best, and I 
     =
 > have to disaggree. I also think it unwise to spend every waking 
      >=
 moment doing sessions. I think it creates that expectation, and 
      > p=
erhaps desperation to make contact, and I would tend not to 
      trust 
 =
     > what comes through. 
      > 
      > I don't trust some of this stu=
ff because I have yet get any 
      > meaningful assistence with the boxes=
 from the so called 
      technicians. 
      > All I ever got was a telep=
athic "suggestion" to use the echo 
      boxes. 
      > Everything else w=
as a assemblage of stuff I had worked on in hte 
      past 
      > to sol=
ve the problem of "what else could I use". 
      > 
      > I hate to see =
yet another go down the road of "this is the 
      onlyest 
      > way". =

      > 
      > Frank-S
      >
